title.rendered: Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer: How the Big 3 dominate men’s tennis & the road to GOAT

content.rendered:
Novak Djokovic, the ATP’s top ranking four champion won the 7th Wimbledon Grand Slam Title against Australia’s Nick Kyrgios on Sunday. He added one more Grand Slam Title in his career. Now, He became World’s top 2 Grand Slam Winner with 21 Trophies. He is one step back Rafael Nadal(22 Grand Slam Title) and one step ahead from Roger Federer (20 Grand Slam Title).

Following the above the three stars Nadal, Djokovic & Fedrer came in light once again as dominating men’s tennis and the Greatest of All The Times (GOAT) by their Brilliant Performances.

Djokovic, The Serbian tennis professional has made some fresh record after beating Kyrgios in Wimbledon Grand Slam Final. He was participating in his 28th grass ground Grand Slam Final also focusing for 21st Grand Slam Titles,  7th and 4th straight Wimbledon Grand Slam Titles.

After yesterday’s brilliant winning he moved to second position in the list of the highest Grand Slam Winner surpassing the earlier top 2 player of the list Roger Federer, a Russian Tennis champion. Now Federer’s position is 3 three in highest Grand Slam Winner list. Whereas Nadal is still on his top 1 position with 22 GS Titles.

There is a list below, How the above three Champions dominate men’s tennis and the road to GOAT.

Highest Tennis Grand Slam Winner (Men’s) List (Top 5)

Highest Popular Grand Slam Winner (Men’s)  List (Top 5 Since 1968)

(Figure Source: An Leading English Daily)
